intro: Chetyson pulchellum, commonly known as the beautiful chetyson, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
